body.name: Damascus Utility Knife- 5 inch Small Kitchen Knife Damascus VG10 Steel 67-Layer -Olive Wood Handle - Razor Sharp Damascus Knife with Gift Box
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Monday, February 19. Order within 5 hrs 1 min
features: PREMIUM DAMASCUS VG10 STEEL - Made of 67-Layer Damascus VG-10 steel, this chef knife has a high level of rust-resistance, wear resistance, and long-lasting performance. Each blade undergoes ultra-precise vacuum heat treatment to get incredible Rockwell hardness of 60±2 HRC. Sharper, Stay Sharpe longer! Ready to take on any culinary challenge that comes your way.

EXQUISITE OLIVE WOOD HANDLE - Accentuated with its remarkable durability, vibrant hues, and striking grain patterns, this handle represents a high-end, premium addition to any knife and it's easy to control. Through intricate manual grinding and processing, the handle boasts an exquisitely delicate finish, and the stunning mosaic copper flower nail embedded in the handle adds an extra touch of refinement.

A KITCHEN ESSENTIAL THAT EPITOMIZES VERSATILITY - The knife blade is 2X the carbon content of the traditional knife, so our knife is hard enough to take a sharp 12-degree edge per side, channeling your full power with every slice!

PERFECT GIFT IDEA - Cut like a pro with our Damascus knife. Coming with an exquisite and robust gift box, it's an ideal gift for the budding chef or culinary aficionado in your circle, great for Christmas, Weddings, Housewarming, birthdays, Halloween, Mother’s Day, and Father’s Day.
FUJUNI TRUST: Each kitchen knife of FUJUNI will go through multiple strict quality inspection procedures before leaving the factory. If any questions, please feel free to contact us.
body.description: Discover the Precision Cutting of Our VG10 Utility Knife! precision cutting, durability, comfort, and style. 67-layer Damascus VG10 steel features for its durability and sharpness, making a razor-sharp FUJUNI knife. The olive wood handle with a hexagonal design offers a comfortable grip. When combined, the VG10 steel and olive wood handle create a high-quality knife that is not only sharp and durable but also visually appealing. We invite you to experience the art of cutting with our FUJUNI Damascus knife and bring a more rustic, earthy style to your kitchen.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I really liked the olive wood handles they are very comfortable to use. The sharpness of the knife, fork is equally sharp.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars *SHORT TERM UPDATE* Avoid if you don't sharpen your knives; needs a polish right out of the box.
reviews.reviewText: *Update-from 5/5 stars to 3/5*Initially, I expressed doubts about how long the edge would last with such a rough ground bevel, but considering the knife was razor sharp, I did not dock any stars. Now, I can confirm that this is a problem. I care for my knives well--always use a cutting board, always wash by hand immediately after use, always store in a knife block--but that wasn't enough to maintain the edge on this knife. It is still sharp, but degradation at this rate is unacceptable at this price point.For comparison, I have a cheap <$15 8" faberware chefs knife that I put a polished edge on once or twice a year. It's our beater knife and the one everyone else grabs most frequently, but despite more use, an even more aggressive edge angle, and not having been sharpened since July, it's holding it's edge better than this knife. "Cheap" vs "Expensive" steel...it's more about the edge.To me, this means, despite the cost, despite whether the knife is sharp out of the box, it will need a new edge. This is unacceptable for a knife as expensive as this and a deal breaker for those who don't sharpen their knives.One additional complaint: the knife has a point right where your hand sits. Maybe this is normal for this style of knife, but I did cut my hand on it. I immediately ground off the point . It doesn't need to be there in my opinion, but I'm not making nigiri here.*Original review for reference*I cook a lot, I like sharp knives, I have quite a few of them, and I regularly maintain them. Much about kitchen knives (and tools in general) is personal preference and use case, but this knife is a functional work of art. Material and finish feel very high end. It puts all of my knives to shame in that category. In the hand, it feels very light but well made and rigid. Choked up, fingers pinching the blade, gives plenty of fine control. The handle is also long enough that I can pivot it, playing it like a drum stick- extremely fast mincing.Overall, this is a nice, useful addition to a traditional chef's knife and a smaller knife for pairing. I will say, you'll probably want a cleaver for meat prep, but again, it's all about preference.Still, knives are tools, and when the near $100 MSRP is considered, I feel they missed the mark, by JUST a hair. I do not like the bevel they put on. For the uninitiated, you generally want a polished knife bevel; this aids in edge retention over the long haul. It's hard to see in photos, but the bevel is much more crude than even my workhorse victorinox that hasn't seen my sharpening stones for months. Don't get me wrong, the edge is razor sharp, but it's a bit jarring to go from polished steel to a rough machine ground edge edge. I feel I could put a smoother bevel on with just a 750 grit sharpening stone.Still, sharp is sharp, and I can't remember the last time I got a knife or tool with my perfect, preferred bevel/edge. I'll use it for a while as is before giving the ole shapton 8000 grit beauty.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Razor sharp is right
reviews.reviewText: A very nice Damascus steel blade with a wood handle. It is a nice weigh in you hand I minced an onion in a matter of minutes. Love this knife.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This bad boy is sharp, this a very nice knife I was pleasantly surprised at it's workmanship. Comes in a nice box if you are looking for a gift for the blossoming chef in your life.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Oh, yes! This knife is like a gift from the gods of cutlery
reviews.reviewText: We have a lot of knives. We've spent a lot of money on knives. I have brought single-edge knives back from Japan. I've been known to hone favorite knives until I can shave hair from my arm with them.The blade of this knife is one of the finest cutting experiences I have ever known. It glides through anything as if the 'anything' were not there. Since the day we received it, this is the knife both my wife and I reach for, when cooking. It is gorgeous to look upon, and a pleasure to use.The Olive Wood handle is beautiful, as is the Damascus look in the blade (see pictures).For personal taste, I find the balance to be a bit forward when gripping the handle, perhaps more balanced when pinching the back blade edge for certain motions.As much as I love this knife, I do think a hundred bucks is a little much for it, and so I must take that into account. But, had I decided to spend a hundo on a knife .... this might just be the one. Seriously, it is nearly 1am, and I almost want to go cook something, just so I can use it again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars This is very sharp and sturdy
reviews.reviewText: Grass Wall Panels 20” x 20” (12 Pack) - Greenery Wall - Plant Wall Décor for Bathroom & Office – Grass Backdrop – Boxwood Panels for Fence Privacy – Privacy Wall Decorations – Artificial Green WallThese are light in weight and rather large so they, individually, cover a nice amount of area. reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Sharp and sturdy chef knife
reviews.reviewText: I've had the pleasure of using this chef knife for over a month now, and I must say, I absolutely love it. It's impressively sharp and effortlessly slices through both meat and vegetables. The high-quality surface finish adds to its appeal, and the comfortable grip enhances the overall experience.One notable feature is its substantial weight, which provides excellent power when tackling meat with bones. It consistently delivers clean, precise cuts, setting it apart from the other knives in my kitchen. However, it's crucial to remember that this knife's sharpness demands extra care and caution when handling it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Chopped My Way to Culinary Stardom
reviews.reviewText: Yo, kitchen warriors 🍴✨ So, I'm not usually the kind to get all jazzed up about knives. But man, this FUJUNI Santoku Knife is on a whole other level First up, can we just admire that killer olive wood handle? I mean, I've been showing it off like it's a new car. And that lil' copper flower detail? Pure class.I've had a bunch of knives before, and most of them go blunt faster than I can chop an onion. But this bad boy? Razor-sharp and stays that way. Slicing, dicing, mincing – it's all smooth sailing. The weight and grip feel just right, and it cuts like a dream. I swear, I felt like I was on a cooking show, minus the dramatic music.Plus, the fact that it came in a posh gift box? Makes me wish I got another one as a gift for my foodie mate's birthday. Speaking of gifts, if you've got someone in your life who's all about that chef life, this is THE gift. Christmas, birthdays, heck, even Halloween if you wanna get fancy while carving pumpkins.
Das schönste und schärfste Messer, was ich je gesehen und benutzt habe….wunderbar !

1ere utilisation aujourd'hui pour désossé une poitrine de porc. PARFAIT! J'avais l'impression d'avoir un scalpel en main. J'ai fait ce que j'avais a faire bien plus rapidement et précis qu'avec un couteau a désossé classique qui coupe moins bien et est plus grand/gros. Testé sur un saucisson +/- sec, comme dans du beurre. Comme c'est un couteau "utilitaire" je vais m'en servir souvent, j’espère que le tranchant restera un maximum de temps et que le jour ou je vais devoir l'affuté je vais pas flingué le fil.

La spedizione è stata rapida ed efficiente, benché sotto Natale. Il coltello è esattamente come in descrizione. La lama è affilatissima e l'impugnatura in legno d'ulivo comoda e molto bella. Per un appassionata di cucina è perfetto.

reviews.reviewTitle: Conforme à la description, bon produit.
reviews.reviewText: Conforme à la description, bon produit.
War ein Geschenk, daher kann ich jetzt noch nichts zur Benutzung sagenaber Verarbeitung ist top, die Griffe ein richtiger Blickfang, der Damast schön zu sehen und brutal scharfSehr empfehlenswert
